sentence: U.S. market indexes were higher on Tuesday.
For the day, the Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 18547.30 for a gain of 17.88 points, or 0.10%.
The S&P 500 was also higher, closing at 2186.90 for a gain of 4.26 points, or 0.20%.
The Nasdaq Composite closed higher at 5260.08 for a gain of 15.47 points, or 0.29%.
The VIX Volatility Index was higher for the day at 12.40 for a gain of 0.13 points, or 1.06%.

In the Dow Jones Industrial Average, the following stocks led gains:

Market indexes regained ground on Tuesday after losses.
Manufacturing was a key focus on the economic calendar for the day.
The PMI Manufacturing Index was down slightly to 52.1 from 52.9 and below consensus of 53.2.
The Richmond Manufacturing Index was also lower at -11, following a reading of 10 in the previous month.
In the housing market, new home sales gained.
The New Home Sales report showed new home sales at 654,000 SAAR, which was above consensus of 580,000 and up from the previous monthAAAs 582,000.

Continued growth in the housing market and positive support for a rate increase helped stocks to gain.
A positive overall second quarter for earnings also helped stocks on Tuesday.
Electronics retail company Best Buy (BBY) added to the dayAAAs gains, beating estimates and reporting positive comparable sales in the industry.
Best BuyAAAs stock gained 20% for the day.
The valuation gains helped stocks reach for new highs on Tuesday, with the Nasdaq Composite reporting a new intraday high.
In a CNBC report Tuesday, market specialists gave their insight on the dayAAAs trading and potential for continued positive momentum.
